solution_line_template: Sammy is offering to take the whole collection of {total_records} records and pay Peggy {sammy_price_per_record} dollars each for them which would net Peggy {total_records} * {sammy_price_per_record}=<<{total_records}*{sammy_price_per_record}={sammy_total_profit}>>{sammy_total_profit} dollars for her entire record collection.

Bryan is willing to buy Peggy's entire record collection but at two different price points, half at one point and half at another. Half of Peggy's record collection is {total_records}/{half_divisor}=<<{total_records}/{half_divisor}={half_records}>>{half_records}, which means that {half_records} records will sell for one price and {half_records} records will sell for another price.

Bryan is willing to pay more for the half of the record collection that he is interested in so Peggy would net {half_records} * {bryan_interested_price}=<<{half_records}*{bryan_interested_price}={bryan_interested_profit}>>{bryan_interested_profit} dollars for the first half of her record collection.

For the half of the collection that Bryan is just planning on reselling at a later date, he is willing to offer Peggy {half_records} *{bryan_other_half_price}=<<{half_records}*{bryan_other_half_price}={bryan_other_half_profit}>>{bryan_other_half_profit} dollars to take off of her hands.

In total Bryan is willing to offer Peggy {bryan_interested_profit}+{bryan_other_half_profit}=<<{bryan_interested_profit}+{bryan_other_half_profit}={bryan_total_profit}>>{bryan_total_profit} dollars for her entire record collection.

If Sammy is offering {sammy_total_profit} dollars to buy Peggy's entire record collection and Bryan is offering {bryan_total_profit} dollars for Peggy's entire record collection, then Peggy's net profit would be {sammy_total_profit}-{bryan_total_profit}=<<{sammy_total_profit}-{bryan_total_profit}={profit_difference}>>{profit_difference} dollars more by taking Sammy's deal instead of Bryan's deal.
